switch.name: switch
switch.description: The switch-statement passes a variable for value comparison to several case-statements (switch-cases).

case.name: switch-case
case.description: Case-block for a switch-statement. If the condition matches the variable given in the switch-statement, the subsequent block of code will get executed. This component automatically creates a break-statement, i.e. the break is not visualized in the edit view).

functionCall.name: Call --> Execute
functionCall.description: Executes an external program and returns the output of the executed command up to a maximum size

variable.name: executeAs
variable.label: Execute as
variable.description: Defines whether to execute the command as a Shell command, as an Asterisk Application command for as an Asterisk CLI Command. Default is Shell Command. Asterisk Application Commands (ex: MeetMe(ConfRoomNum|1dxA)) require an active channel and have no output. Return codes: -2: application not found; -10: no active channel; -11: command cannot be parsed. List of supported Asterisk Application Commands can be seen on http://www.voip-info.org/wiki/view/Asterisk+-+documentation+of+application+commands or by executing the show applications CLI Command. Asterisk CLI Commands (ex: core show channels) do not require an active channel and can return an output string depending on the executed CLI command. A list of Asterisk CLI commands can be seen on http://www.voip-info.org/wiki/view/Asterisk+CLI or by executing the help CLI command.

variable.name: executeAsRoot
variable.label: Superuser
variable.description: If 'true', the command will be executed with 'root' rights. For Shell Commands only.

variable.name: bufferSize
variable.label: Max output length
variable.description: Max output lengt (bytes). For Shell Commands only.

variable.name: output
variable.label: Output
variable.description: Returned output. Empty for Asterisk Application Commands.

variable.name: errorOutput
variable.label: Error output
variable.description: Error output of process. Shell Commands only.

variable.name: resultCode
variable.label: Return code
variable.description: Return code. Value different than 0 indicates abnormal execution depending on the executed application.

switchDefault.name: switch-default
switchDefault.description: A default-block in a switch-statement is placed prior to the code block to be executed if all preceding case-statements have proven false.

functionCall.name: Call --> Log
functionCall.description: Logs a message to the module log file. Log files can be accessed in the according tab of the module designer and in the first tab of the module configurations. Error messages will additionally be appended to the STARFACE error log.

item.value: No service restart configured. Please restart the STARFACE services in order to activate the new timing source.

functionCall.name: Call --> GetConnection
functionCall.description: Creates a new connection to an external database

variable.name: dbType
variable.label: Type
variable.description: Type of database to be connected

variable.name: userName
variable.label: Username
variable.description: Username for authentification at the database server

variable.name: password
variable.label: Password
variable.description: Password for authentification at the database server

variable.name: optionString
variable.label: Options
variable.description: Optional parameters passed to the database server at connection start

if2.description: An if-statement causes the function to execute a subordinate section of code only if the specified condition is met

functionCall.name: Call --> Append
functionCall.description: Appends text fragments and returns the combined string

functionCall.name: Call --> Log
functionCall.description: Logs a message to the module log file. Log files can be accessed in the according tab of the module designer and in the first tab of the module configurations. Error messages will additionally be appended to the STARFACE error log.

functionCall.name: Call --> UpdateStatement
functionCall.description: Executes the given SQL statement, which may be an INSERT, UPDATE, or DELETE statement or an SQL statement that returns nothing, such as an SQL DDL statement.

variable.name: count
variable.label: Count
variable.description: Either the number of rows affected by INSERT, UPDATE or DELETE statements, or 0 for SQL statements which return nothing

variable.name: errorOccured
variable.description: Will be 'true' if an error occured while executing the SQL statement

functionCall.name: Call --> CloseConnection
functionCall.description: Releases a connection's resources immediately instead of waiting for them to be automatically released

else.name: else
else.description: The else-statement provides an alternative path of execution for if-statements

varAssign.name: variable assignment
varAssign.description: Assigns a value to a variable

variable.name: value
variable.description: Select a variable to get the value from or use the input field for direct value assignment

variable.name: target
variable.description: Variable that will contain the new value

functionCall.name: Call --> WriteToFile
functionCall.description: Writes text in a file

variable.name: append
variable.label: Append
variable.description: If true, the text will be appended to the file content. Otherwise, the existing content will be overwritten.

variable.name: text
variable.label: Text
variable.description: Text to write in the specified file

variable.name: successful
variable.description: 'true' if and only if the text was successfully written to the specified file

infotext.name: Warning
infotext.description:
The action selected above will be taken immediately after you save the module
and again when you enable / disable or delete the module.

There will be no further confirmation.

infotext.name: Asterisk timing sources
infotext.description:
res_timing_dahdi (default)

uses timing mechanisms provided by DAHDI.
This method of timing was previously the only means by which Asterisk could receive timing.
It has the benefit of being efficient, and if a system is already going to use DAHDI hardware, then it makes good sense to use this timing source. If, however, there is no need for DAHDI other than as a timing source, this timing source may seem unattractive.

res_timing_timerfd

uses a timing mechanism provided directly by the Linux kernel. See also: timerfd manual page
This interface has the benefit of being very efficient, but at the time this is being written, it is a relatively new feature on Linux, meaning that its availability is not widespread.

Source (retrieved 2016-06-17): https://wiki.asterisk.org/wiki/display/AST/Timing+Interfaces

entries.value:
res_timing_dahdi (default)

uses timing mechanisms provided by DAHDI.
This method of timing was previously the only means by which Asterisk could receive timing.
It has the benefit of being efficient, and if a system is already going to use DAHDI hardware, then it makes good sense to use this timing source. If, however, there is no need for DAHDI other than as a timing source, this timing source may seem unattractive.

res_timing_timerfd

uses a timing mechanism provided directly by the Linux kernel. See also: timerfd manual page
This interface has the benefit of being very efficient, but at the time this is being written, it is a relatively new feature on Linux, meaning that its availability is not widespread.

Source (retrieved 2016-06-17): https://wiki.asterisk.org/wiki/display/AST/Timing+Interfaces

infotext.name: FAQ
infotext.description:
How do I apply the changes?

Just save or disable and reenable the module instance.
Attention: The "service restart" action defined under Settings will be executed on these actions:
  1. Saving a module instance
  2. Enabling a module instance
  3. Disabling a module instance
  4. Deleting a module instance
